18#include "AZHighLevelEncoder.h"
19#include "AZEncodingState.h"
20#include "AZToken.h"

24#include <array>
25#include <cstdint>
26#include <algorithm>
27#include <list>

30namespace ZXing {
31namespace Aztec {
32
33// Do not change these constants
34static const int MODE_UPPER = 0; // 5 bits
35static const int MODE_LOWER = 1; // 5 bits
36static const int MODE_DIGIT = 2; // 4 bits
37static const int MODE_MIXED = 3; // 5 bits
38static const int MODE_PUNCT = 4; // 5 bits
39
40// The Latch Table shows, for each pair of Modes, the optimal method for
41// getting from one mode to another. In the worst possible case, this can
42// be up to 14 bits. In the best possible case, we are already there!
43// The high half-word of each entry gives the number of bits.
44// The low half-word of each entry are the actual bits necessary to change
45static const std::array<std::array<int, 5>, 5> LATCH_TABLE = {
46 0,
47 (5 << 16) + 28, // UPPER -> LOWER
48 (5 << 16) + 30, // UPPER -> DIGIT
49 (5 << 16) + 29, // UPPER -> MIXED
50 (10 << 16) + (29 << 5) + 30, // UPPER -> MIXED -> PUNCT
51
52 (9 << 16) + (30 << 4) + 14, // LOWER -> DIGIT -> UPPER
53 0,
54 (5 << 16) + 30, // LOWER -> DIGIT
55 (5 << 16) + 29, // LOWER -> MIXED
56 (10 << 16) + (29 << 5) + 30, // LOWER -> MIXED -> PUNCT
57
58 (4 << 16) + 14, // DIGIT -> UPPER
59 (9 << 16) + (14 << 5) + 28, // DIGIT -> UPPER -> LOWER
60 0,
61 (9 << 16) + (14 << 5) + 29, // DIGIT -> UPPER -> MIXED
62 (14 << 16) + (14 << 10) + (29 << 5) + 30,
63 // DIGIT -> UPPER -> MIXED -> PUNCT
64
65 (5 << 16) + 29, // MIXED -> UPPER
66 (5 << 16) + 28, // MIXED -> LOWER
67 (10 << 16) + (29 << 5) + 30, // MIXED -> UPPER -> DIGIT
68 0,
69 (5 << 16) + 30, // MIXED -> PUNCT
70
71 (5 << 16) + 31, // PUNCT -> UPPER
72 (10 << 16) + (31 << 5) + 28, // PUNCT -> UPPER -> LOWER
73 (10 << 16) + (31 << 5) + 30, // PUNCT -> UPPER -> DIGIT
74 (10 << 16) + (31 << 5) + 29, // PUNCT -> UPPER -> MIXED
75 0,
76};
77
78// A reverse mapping from [mode][char] to the encoding for that character
79// in that mode. An entry of 0 indicates no mapping exists.
80static const std::array<std::array<int8_t, 256>, 5>& InitCharMap()
81{
82 static std::array<std::array<int8_t, 256>, 5> charmap = {};
83 charmap[MODE_UPPER][' '] = 1;
84 for (int c = 'A'; c <= 'Z'; c++) {
85 charmap[MODE_UPPER][c] = c - 'A' + 2;
86 }
87 charmap[MODE_LOWER][' '] = 1;
88 for (int c = 'a'; c <= 'z'; c++) {
89 charmap[MODE_LOWER][c] = c - 'a' + 2;
90 }
91 charmap[MODE_DIGIT][' '] = 1;
92 for (int c = '0'; c <= '9'; c++) {
93 charmap[MODE_DIGIT][c] = c - '0' + 2;
94 }
95 charmap[MODE_DIGIT][','] = 12;
96 charmap[MODE_DIGIT]['.'] = 13;
97 const int8_t mixedTable[] = {
98 0x00, 0x20, 0x01, 0x02, 0x03, 0x04, 0x05, 0x06, 0x07, 0x08, 0x09, 0x0a,
99 0x0b, 0x0c, 0x0d, 0x1b, 0x1c, 0x1d, 0x1e, 0x1f, 0x40, 0x5c, 0x5e,
100 0x5f, 0x60, 0x7c, 0x7d, 0x7f,
101 };
102 for (uint8_t i = 0; i < Size(mixedTable); i++) {
103 charmap[MODE_MIXED][mixedTable[i]] = i;
104 }
105 const char punctTable[] = {
106 '\0', '\r', '\0', '\0', '\0', '\0', '!', '\'', '#', '$', '%', '&', '\'',
107 '(', ')', '*', '+', ',', '-', '.', '/', ':', ';', '<', '=', '>', '?',
108 '[', ']', '{', '}'
109 };
110 for (uint8_t i = 0; i < Size(punctTable); i++) {
111 if (punctTable[i] > 0) {
112 charmap[MODE_PUNCT][punctTable[i]] = i;
113 }
114 }
115 return charmap;
116}
117const std::array<std::array<int8_t, 256>, 5>& CHAR_MAP = InitCharMap();
118
119// A map showing the available shift codes. (The shifts to BINARY are not shown
120static const std::array<std::array<int8_t, 6>, 6>& InitShiftTable()
121{
122 static std::array<std::array<int8_t, 6>, 6> table;
123
124 for (auto& row : table) {
125 std::fill(row.begin(), row.end(), -1);
126 }
127 table[MODE_UPPER][MODE_PUNCT] = 0;
128 table[MODE_LOWER][MODE_PUNCT] = 0;
129 table[MODE_LOWER][MODE_UPPER] = 28;
130 table[MODE_MIXED][MODE_PUNCT] = 0;
131 table[MODE_DIGIT][MODE_PUNCT] = 0;
132 table[MODE_DIGIT][MODE_UPPER] = 15;
133 return table;
134}
135
136const std::array<std::array<int8_t, 6>, 6>& SHIFT_TABLE = InitShiftTable();
137
138// Create a new state representing this state with a latch to a (not
139// necessary different) mode, and then a code.
140static EncodingState LatchAndAppend(const EncodingState& state, int mode, int value)
141{
142 //assert binaryShiftByteCount == 0;
143 int bitCount = state.bitCount;
144 auto tokens = state.tokens;
145 if (mode != state.mode) {
146 int latch = LATCH_TABLE[state.mode][mode];
147 tokens.push_back(Token::CreateSimple(latch & 0xFFFF, latch >> 16));
148 bitCount += latch >> 16;
149 }
150 int latchModeBitCount = mode == MODE_DIGIT ? 4 : 5;
151 tokens.push_back(Token::CreateSimple(value, latchModeBitCount));
152 return EncodingState{ tokens, mode, 0, bitCount + latchModeBitCount };
153}
154
155// Create a new state representing this state, with a temporary shift
156// to a different mode to output a single value.
157static EncodingState ShiftAndAppend(const EncodingState& state, int mode, int value)
158{
159 //assert binaryShiftByteCount == 0 && this.mode != mode;
160 int thisModeBitCount = state.mode == MODE_DIGIT ? 4 : 5;
161 // Shifts exist only to UPPER and PUNCT, both with tokens size 5.
162 auto tokens = state.tokens;
163 tokens.push_back(Token::CreateSimple(SHIFT_TABLE[state.mode][mode], thisModeBitCount));
164 tokens.push_back(Token::CreateSimple(value, 5));
165 return EncodingState{ tokens, state.mode, 0, state.bitCount + thisModeBitCount + 5 };
166}
167
168// Create the state identical to this one, but we are no longer in
169// Binary Shift mode.
170static EncodingState EndBinaryShift(const EncodingState& state, int index)
171{
172 if (state.binaryShiftByteCount == 0) {
173 return state;
174 }
175 auto tokens = state.tokens;
176 tokens.push_back(Token::CreateBinaryShift(index - state.binaryShiftByteCount, state.binaryShiftByteCount));
177 //assert token.getTotalBitCount() == this.bitCount;
178 return EncodingState{ tokens, state.mode, 0, state.bitCount };
179}
180
181// Create a new state representing this state, but an additional character
182// output in Binary Shift mode.
183static EncodingState AddBinaryShiftChar(const EncodingState& state, int index)
184{
185 auto tokens = state.tokens;
186 int mode = state.mode;
187 int bitCount = state.bitCount;
188 if (state.mode == MODE_PUNCT || state.mode == MODE_DIGIT) {
189 //assert binaryShiftByteCount == 0;
190 int latch = LATCH_TABLE[mode][MODE_UPPER];
191 tokens.push_back(Token::CreateSimple(latch & 0xFFFF, latch >> 16));
192 bitCount += latch >> 16;
193 mode = MODE_UPPER;
194 }
195 int deltaBitCount = (state.binaryShiftByteCount == 0 || state.binaryShiftByteCount == 31) ? 18 : (state.binaryShiftByteCount == 62) ? 9 : 8;
196 EncodingState result{ tokens, mode, state.binaryShiftByteCount + 1, bitCount + deltaBitCount };
197 if (result.binaryShiftByteCount == 2047 + 31) {
198 // The string is as long as it's allowed to be. We should end it.
199 result = EndBinaryShift(result, index + 1);
200 }
201 return result;
202}
203
204static int CalculateBinaryShiftCost(const EncodingState& state)
205{
206 if (state.binaryShiftByteCount > 62) {
207 return 21; // B/S with extended length
208 }
209 if (state.binaryShiftByteCount > 31) {
210 return 20; // two B/S
211 }
212 if (state.binaryShiftByteCount > 0) {
213 return 10; // one B/S
214 }
215 return 0;
216}
217
218// Returns true if "this" state is better (or equal) to be in than "that"
219// state under all possible circumstances.
220static bool IsBetterThanOrEqualTo(const EncodingState& state, const EncodingState& other)
221{
222 int newModeBitCount = state.bitCount + (LATCH_TABLE[state.mode][other.mode] >> 16);
223 if (state.binaryShiftByteCount < other.binaryShiftByteCount) {
224 // add additional B/S encoding cost of other, if any
225 newModeBitCount += CalculateBinaryShiftCost(other) - CalculateBinaryShiftCost(state);
226 }
227 else if (state.binaryShiftByteCount > other.binaryShiftByteCount && other.binaryShiftByteCount > 0) {
228 // maximum possible additional cost (we end up exceeding the 31 byte boundary and other state can stay beneath it)
229 newModeBitCount += 10;
230 }
231 return newModeBitCount <= other.bitCount;
232}
233
234static BitArray ToBitArray(const EncodingState& state, const std::string& text)
235{
236 auto endState = EndBinaryShift(state, Size(text));
237 BitArray bits;
238 // Add each token to the result.
239 for (const Token& symbol : endState.tokens) {
240 symbol.appendTo(bits, text);
241 }
242 //assert bitArray.getSize() == this.bitCount;
243 return bits;
244}
245
246static void UpdateStateForPair(const EncodingState& state, int index, int pairCode, std::list<EncodingState>& result)
247{
248 EncodingState stateNoBinary = EndBinaryShift(state, index);
249 // Possibility 1. Latch to MODE_PUNCT, and then append this code
250 result.push_back(LatchAndAppend(stateNoBinary, MODE_PUNCT, pairCode));
251 if (state.mode != MODE_PUNCT) {
252 // Possibility 2. Shift to MODE_PUNCT, and then append this code.
253 // Every state except MODE_PUNCT (handled above) can shift
254 result.push_back(ShiftAndAppend(stateNoBinary, MODE_PUNCT, pairCode));
255 }
256 if (pairCode == 3 || pairCode == 4) {
257 // both characters are in DIGITS. Sometimes better to just add two digits
258 auto digitState = LatchAndAppend(stateNoBinary, MODE_DIGIT, 16 - pairCode); // period or comma in DIGIT
259 result.push_back(LatchAndAppend(digitState, MODE_DIGIT, 1)); // space in DIGIT
260 }
261 if (state.binaryShiftByteCount > 0) {
262 // It only makes sense to do the characters as binary if we're already
263 // in binary mode.
264 result.push_back(AddBinaryShiftChar(AddBinaryShiftChar(state, index), index + 1));
265 }
266}
267
268
269static std::list<EncodingState> SimplifyStates(const std::list<EncodingState>& states)
270{
271 std::list<EncodingState> result;
272 for (auto& newState : states) {
273 bool add = true;
274 for (auto iterator = result.begin(); iterator != result.end();) {
275 auto& oldState = *iterator;
276 if (IsBetterThanOrEqualTo(oldState, newState)) {
277 add = false;
278 break;
279 }
280 if (IsBetterThanOrEqualTo(newState, oldState)) {
281 iterator = result.erase(iterator);
282 }
283 else {
284 ++iterator;
285 }
286 }
287 if (add) {
288 result.push_back(newState);
289 }
290 }
291 return result;
292}
293
294static std::list<EncodingState> UpdateStateListForPair(const std::list<EncodingState>& states, int index, int pairCode)
295{
296 std::list<EncodingState> result;
297 for (auto& state : states) {
298 UpdateStateForPair(state, index, pairCode, result);
299 }
300 return SimplifyStates(result);
301}
302
303
304
305// Return a set of states that represent the possible ways of updating this
306// state for the next character. The resulting set of states are added to
307// the "result" list.
308static void UpdateStateForChar(const EncodingState& state, const std::string& text, int index, std::list<EncodingState>& result)
309{
310 int ch = text[index] & 0xff;
311 bool charInCurrentTable = CHAR_MAP[state.mode][ch] > 0;
312 EncodingState stateNoBinary;
313 bool firstTime = true;
314 for (int mode = 0; mode <= MODE_PUNCT; mode++) {
315 int charInMode = CHAR_MAP[mode][ch];
316 if (charInMode > 0) {
317 if (firstTime) {
318 // Only create stateNoBinary the first time it's required.
319 stateNoBinary = EndBinaryShift(state, index);
320 firstTime = false;
321 }
322 // Try generating the character by latching to its mode
323 if (!charInCurrentTable || mode == state.mode || mode == MODE_DIGIT) {
324 // If the character is in the current table, we don't want to latch to
325 // any other mode except possibly digit (which uses only 4 bits). Any
326 // other latch would be equally successful *after* this character, and
327 // so wouldn't save any bits.
328 result.push_back(LatchAndAppend(stateNoBinary, mode, charInMode));
329 }
330 // Try generating the character by switching to its mode.
331 if (!charInCurrentTable && SHIFT_TABLE[state.mode][mode] >= 0) {
332 // It never makes sense to temporarily shift to another mode if the
333 // character exists in the current mode. That can never save bits.
334 result.push_back(ShiftAndAppend(stateNoBinary, mode, charInMode));
335 }
336 }
337 }
338 if (state.binaryShiftByteCount > 0 || CHAR_MAP[state.mode][ch] == 0) {
339 // It's never worthwhile to go into binary shift mode if you're not already
340 // in binary shift mode, and the character exists in your current mode.
341 // That can never save bits over just outputting the char in the current mode.
342 result.push_back(AddBinaryShiftChar(state, index));
343 }
344}
345
346// We update a set of states for a new character by updating each state
347// for the new character, merging the results, and then removing the
348// non-optimal states.
349static std::list<EncodingState> UpdateStateListForChar(const std::list<EncodingState>& states, const std::string& text, int index)
350{
351 std::list<EncodingState> result;
352 for (auto& state : states) {
353 UpdateStateForChar(state, text, index, result);
354 }
355 return result.size() > 1 ? SimplifyStates(result) : result;
356}
357
358/**
359* @return text represented by this encoder encoded as a {@link BitArray}
360*/
361BitArray
362HighLevelEncoder::Encode(const std::string& text)
363{
364 std::list<EncodingState> states;
365 states.push_back(EncodingState{ std::vector<Token>(), MODE_UPPER, 0, 0 });
366 for (int index = 0; index < Size(text); index++) {
367 int pairCode;
368 int nextChar = index + 1 < Size(text) ? text[index + 1] : 0;
369 switch (text[index]) {
370 case '\r':
371 pairCode = nextChar == '\n' ? 2 : 0;
372 break;
373 case '.':
374 pairCode = nextChar == ' ' ? 3 : 0;
375 break;
376 case ',':
377 pairCode = nextChar == ' ' ? 4 : 0;
378 break;
379 case ':':
380 pairCode = nextChar == ' ' ? 5 : 0;
381 break;
382 default:
383 pairCode = 0;
384 }
385 if (pairCode > 0) {
386 // We have one of the four special PUNCT pairs. Treat them specially.
387 // Get a new set of states for the two new characters.
388 states = UpdateStateListForPair(states, index, pairCode);
389 index++;
390 }
391 else {
392 // Get a new set of states for the new character.
393 states = UpdateStateListForChar(states, text, index);
394 }
395 }
396 // We are left with a set of states. Find the shortest one.
397 EncodingState minState = *std::min_element(states.begin(), states.end(), [](const EncodingState& a, const EncodingState& b) { return a.bitCount < b.bitCount; });
398 // Convert it to a bit array, and return.
399 return ToBitArray(minState, text);
400}
401
